image.altText: Villawood Immigration Detention Centre

props.synopsis: An Iranian man facing removal to Nauru under a controversial agreement will ask the High Court to find the government's plans to deport him lack procedural fairness.

title.children: Government deal sending non-citizens to Nauru faces High Court challenge

image.altText: Stuffed animals and a crucifix laid on a stump, with the names Aaron French, Brooke Sorlie, and Charlie Quinn written on it.

props.synopsis: A young driver who crashed his car near Tarago, killing his girlfriend and two friends, has been sentenced to more than six years in jail.

title.children: 'You promised you would look after her': Tarago crash driver jailed

image.altText: The wreck of a vehicle near a road.

props.synopsis: Police say the driver of the car was cut from the wreck and taken to hospital but died a short time later.

title.children: Wanted man dies in head-on truck crash after police pursuit

image.altText: Underwater Rugby players

props.synopsis: As temperatures soar, advocates of public pools in Canberra say they want to see greater support and investment for facilities in the national capital.

title.children: 'Trend is they're going': Concerns for the future of Canberra's public pools

image.altText: A drone shot of airbag jumps on a grassy hill.

props.synopsis: At a time when many Aussies are heading off for beach holidays, a group of snow sports athletes are chasing winter with their sights set on the next Olympic Games.

title.children: Aussies chase Winter Olympic glory with off-snow training in Jindabyne

image.altText: A blue bus travelling through Canberra's city centre

props.synopsis: The ACT government says the bus network will change from term 1 next year as it flags major disruption from work on Commonwealth Avenue Bridge.

title.children: 'Go out for dinner': Free fares for summer amid Canberra construction chaos

image.altText: Cartoon of Anthony Albanese sitting alone in the Speaker's chair in the House of Representatives.

props.synopsis: The annual showcase of the year's top political cartoons has opened at Old Parliament House in Canberra, depicting the biggest national and global events with satire and wit.

title.children: 'A lot to poke fun at': The best political cartoons of 2025

image.altText: A map shows Japan's island's with an orange circle radiating off its northern coastline

props.synopsis: The quake has seen a tsunami warning issued for large parts of Japan's northern coastline and some 90,000 people ordered to evacuate to higher ground.

title.children: Magnitude-7.6 quake in Japan prompts tsunami warning and evacuation order

image.altText: Four men stand outside a door looking at one another, while two of them shake hands.

props.synopsis: Leaders express scepticism about US-led plans to end Russia's invasion, after peace talks between US and Ukranian officials at the weekend ended without a breakthrough.

title.children: Zelenskyy meets with European allies at 'critical' moment for Ukraine

image.altText: People dressed in white, all-body suits at the entrance to a building.

props.synopsis: A doctor in the US who found asbestos in his son's sandpit tried in vain to get stronger regulations. Almost 40 years later he says he's "not surprised" the problem re-emerged in Australia.

title.children: Fluke discoveries of asbestos in children's play sand strike twice decades apart

image.altText: A boy in a school uniform near a horse float, shed and paddock on a farm.

props.synopsis: Farmers and business on the Mid North Coast are reeling after a fire tore through the area last week, destroying homes and forcing families to evacuate properties.

title.children: Farmer returns after bushfire to find secured sheep chased and injured

image.altText: Two teenage boys with brown hair and beige shirts sit together and smile.

props.synopsis: Patrick, 15, does not use social media and hopes he never does. Nick, 15, had a flip phone for the first few years of high school. Here is why they support the social media ban.

title.children: Why these two teenagers support the social media ban

image.altText: A man and a woman in button up shirts, in an outdoor setting.

props.synopsis: In his first interview since formally joining One Nation, Barnaby Joyce says he sees comparisons between his new party and Britain's far-right Reform UK party under populist leader Nigel Farage.

title.children: One Nation part of global populist movement in politics, Barnaby Joyce says

image.altText: A young man with a thin moustache looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: Frankenstein actor Jacob Elordi is Australia's big hope at the Golden Globes after scoring two nominations overnight for the 83rd iteration of the film and television awards.

title.children: Jacob Elordi, Rose Byrne and Joel Edgerton score Golden Globes nominations

image.altText: Logos of Paramount, Netflix and Warner Bros brought together in one illustration

props.synopsis: The offer paves the way for a battle between Paramount — whose owner, Larry Ellison, is an ally of Donald Trump — and streaming behemoth Netflix to buy one of Hollywood's most storied studios.

title.children: Paramount counters Netflix with hostile bid for Warner Bros

image.altText: A body lifted on a stretcher into a van by the Thai army.

props.synopsis: Thailand launches air strikes along its disputed border with Cambodia, after both countries accuse one another of breaching a ceasefire agreement brokered by US President Donald Trump.

title.children: Thailand launches air strikes amid new clashes with Cambodia

image.altText: Two women smile as they sign documents in front of a crowd.

props.synopsis: The Victorian government is set to make a historic apology to Aboriginal Victorians today, in one of the first public acts to follow the signing of the state's treaty agreement.

title.children: Victorian government to make historic apology to Aboriginal Victorians

image.altText: Men in high-vis vests tear down a tent in a public park.

props.synopsis: The City of Moreton Bay council violated the human rights of homeless campers when they destroyed their tents and belongings in April, the Supreme Court has heard.

title.children: Council faces court after destroying homeless camps

image.altText: a doctor and a nurse giving vaccinations to young girls

props.synopsis: The eradication of smallpox 46 years ago has been cheered as the greatest triumph of global public health. It has also been held up as a model for global cooperation.

title.children: 300 million dead in 100 years: How we eradicated a killer

image.altText: A graphic showing 31 bottles of sunscreen against an orange tile background.

props.synopsis: It's been almost two years since Craig Jones first ran preliminary tests on his zinc sunscreen. When he discovered it wasn't providing the SPF it was supposed to he threw it out and set out on a quest to find out why.

title.children: More SPF50 zinc sunscreens under the spotlight after preliminary testing shows lower protection

image.altText: Wentworth Park Greyhound track in Glebe

props.synopsis: After more than 90 years, greyhound racing will end at Wentworth Park in Glebe, with the public land to be be transferred to the City of Sydney.

title.children: Greyhound track to be bulldozed after 90 years making way for green space

image.altText: Toyah Cordingley smiles as she hold a wrapped present while standing in front of a mural.

props.synopsis: It took a jury in the Supreme Court in Cairns seven hours to reach the unanimous guilty verdict after an almost four-week retrial.

title.children: Toyah Cordingley murdered by former nurse, jury finds

image.altText: Ashton Hurn smiles and looks to the side in front of a large tree

props.synopsis: South Australia's new opposition leader Ashton Hurn has likened the task ahead of her to climbing a mountain, but she's taking inspiration from a family background that includes a former state cricketer and an AFL premiership captain.

title.children: Ashton Hurn likens her new job to scaling a mountain, but it follows an already rapid ascension

image.altText: A smiling, fair-haired man with a stethoscope around his neck sits in an office.

props.synopsis: The suspension of Tim Lane leaves a Central Queensland town of 3,000 people with no permanent hospital doctor or GP.

title.children: Rural Queensland town loses only permanent doctor

image.altText: A close-up shot of Donald Trump speaking in front of a dark background while wearing a black tuxedo.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump has made the Kennedy Center a touchstone in a broader attack against what he claims is "woke", anti-American culture.

title.children: Trump makes history hosting Kennedy Center Honors — here's how we got here

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Anika Wells press conference

props.synopsis: The Coalition is applying more heat to Sport Minister Anika Wells over flights she claimed for herself and her husband to attend two Boxing Day cricket test matches in recent years, and several AFL Grand Final events.

title.children: Coalition puts heat on Wells over trips to cricket and AFL with family

image.altText: A toy car on fire

props.synopsis: Fire services are urging people to buy lithium-ion battery products from reputable suppliers ahead of Christmas after yet another house fire was suspected to have been caused by a lithium battery on the weekend.

title.children: Another house fire likely sparked by lithium battery as firies reissue safety warnings

image.altText: Conjoined twins in knitted red, yellow, black and white hats underneath a blanket in an aircraft.

props.synopsis: Surgeons have separated a rare set of conjoined twins after they were urgently flown from Papua New Guinea to Australia, but only one of the boys has survived.

title.children: One of PNG's rare conjoined twins dies after urgent surgery

image.altText: Image (10)

props.synopsis: Jim Chalmers says the end to the "temporary" subsidy was a "hard" decision but recognises pressures on the budget.

title.children: Government will not extend energy bill relief

image.altText: A picture of two septic tanks with lids off in a remote community backyard.

props.synopsis: A coroner's report has found there were multiple missed opportunities to improve or replace the public housing septic system, which the NT government had responsibility for.

title.children: Toddler's septic tank death 'likely would have been prevented' with maintenance

image.altText: A man smiling as he stands in front of a fruit stall

props.synopsis: One year since the Assad dictatorship in Syria was toppled by Islamist rebels, bringing an end to nearly 14 years of civil war, some are celebrating while others continue to struggle.

title.children: One year since Assad was overthrown, this is what life is like in Syria

image.altText: A smiling man in a suit holds up a glass of liquor.

props.synopsis: The founder of a Tasmanian distillery behind an alleged investor fraud scheme has pleaded not guilty to 736 criminal offences.

title.children: Distillery founder pleads not guilty over alleged investor fraud scheme

image.altText: A sketch of a man sitting in court looking straight

props.synopsis: A review has identified 18 points or "missed opportunities" where Ashley Paul Griffith's offending could have been disrupted or stopped, had a different action been taken.

title.children: How paedophile Ashley Paul Griffith escaped scrutiny

image.altText: An illustration of a mother scrolling on her phone, looking at social media.

props.synopsis: Readers share how they approached their online and social media use in the weeks immediately after giving birth.

title.children: Should you go screen-free after giving birth? These mums share their stories

image.altText: Travis Head and Jake Weatherald speak during second Ashes Test at the Gabba in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: Marnus Labuschagne says Australia's opening partnership is making the rest of the batting order improve, as selectors deliberate over Usman Khawaja's Test future.

title.children: Labuschagne praises Aussies' makeshift opening pair as Khawaja call looms
